channel.title: Process time takes longer than the cycle time
channel.description:
Hi, I haven't touched a private server in quite awhile, but I've decided I want to take one on, anyways, my life story aside, I'm having problems with the server taking longer than the set cycle time to process.
My servers cycle time is set at 500ms which is .5 seconds but it's taking around 600ms to process. It's a 474 protocol server if that helps at all.
The time taking to process vary's. It just clocked in at 3000ms!!
I'm pretty sure it's not my computer specs: 2.8Ghz Pentium III dual core 4GB DDR3
It might be a background program that's slowing it down, or could be a common problem with Rs2 severs, but I'm not sure, as I haven't done this in awhile. If someone could give me a list of common programs that could conflict with this, or hint me at a solution, that would be great!

item.title: Process time takes longer than the cycle time
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:3, topic:404428”]Myself, that was all. xD It didn’t appear to lag, just all the queue actions were extremely delayed. The time taking to process vary’s. It just clocked in at 3000ms!!

EDIT:
Is it supposed to run the garbage collector every cycle??[/quote]

I don’t think it should, but I don’t think it would hurt. What base is it?

Read full topic
item.source: Process time takes longer than the cycle time

My servers cycle time is set at 500ms which is .5 seconds but it’s taking around 600ms to process. It’s a 474 protocol server if that helps at all.

I’m pretty sure it’s not my computer specs:
2.8Ghz Pentium III dual core
4GB DDR3

It might be a background program that’s slowing it down, or could be a common problem with Rs2 severs, but I’m not sure, as I haven’t done this in awhile. If someone could give me a list of common programs that could conflict with this, or hint me at a solution, that would be great![/quote]

I think it’s a common problem with servers.

I believe the “official” cycle time is 600ms. How many players are online when you’re testing?

Read full topic
